data.title: Bing Statistics, Facts, Recent Milestones, Background History
data.meta_description: Bing statistics and facts include details about the company, a list of subsidiaries, target audience, and domain-wise audience.
data.text:
Bing is a web search engine owned and operated by Microsoft. The service has its origins in previous Microsoft search engines: MSN Search, Windows Live Search, and later Live Search. Microsoft Corporation developed it using ASP.NET. The company previously launched MSN Search and Windows Live Search. Bing was launched as a replacement for Live Search in mid-2009 in San Diego, California, US. Bing Search Engine is available in forty languages globally and includes a left-hand navigation bar, which is a feature that allows users to preview web pages before visiting them. It also has a feature that categorizes searches and search results based on topics. Subdivision categories of Bing include maps, health, web, and images. In the case of any type of query, Bing creates search categories dynamically. Bing ads are designed for delivering online advertisements to global audiences.

Microsoft Corporation develops, supports, and licenses devices, solutions, services, and software. The company operates in productivity and business processes, intelligent cloud, and more personal computing. Through its more personal computing segment, the company offers patent licensing, Windows volume, OEM, and other non-volume licensing of the Windows operating system; Windows Internet of Things, and MSN display advertising; devices comprising Surface, PC accessories, and other intelligent devices; Bing and Bing Ads search advertising and Xbox hardware and software and services.

According to Microsoft Corporation’s annual report in 2021, revenue increased from US$ 143,015 Mn in 2020 to 168,088 Mn.

Bing Background History of the Company:

4th April 1975: Microsoft was founded

1st January 1979: The company moved from Albuquerque, New Mexico to Bellevue, Washington

25th June 1981: Microsoft officially incorporated

26th February 1986: Microsoft moved to a corporate campus in Redmond, Washington

13th March 1986: The company stock went public

7th December 1995: Bill Gates outlined the company’s commitment to supporting and enhancing the Internet

25th June 1998: The company launched Windows 98

17th February 2000: The company launched Windows 2000

22nd June 2000: Bill Gates and Steve Ballmer outlined the company’s .NET strategy for Web services

31st May 2001: The company launches Office XP

25th October 2001: The company launched Windows XP

15th November 2001: The company launches Xbox

21st October 2003: The company launched the Microsoft Office System

30th January 2007: The company launched Windows Vista and the 2007 Microsoft Office System to consumers globally

3rd June 2009: The company launched the Bing decision engine

22nd October 2009: The company launched Windows 7 and opened the first physical store in Scottsdale, Arizona

10th November 2010: The company launched Windows Phone 7

17th November 2010: The company announced the availability of Microsoft Lync

13th October 13, 2011: The company closed its acquisition of Skype

25th June 2012: The company acquired Yammer

4th September 2012: The company launched Windows Server 2012

12th September 2012: The company launched Visual Studio 2012

26th October 2012: The company launched Windows 8 and Microsoft Surface

29th January 2013: The company launched Office 2013, expands Office 365

18th February 2013: The company launched Outlook.com

3rd September 2013: The company announced the decision to acquire Nokia’s devices and services business, license Nokia’s patents and mapping services

27th March 2014: The company launched Office for iPad

25th April 2014: The company completed the acquisition of Nokia Devices and Services business

Nov. 6, 2014: The company announced Office apps for Android tablets

29th July 2015: The company launched Windows 10

1st June 2016: The company launched SQL Server 2016

29th September 2016: The company announced the formation of a new AI and Research Group

18th October 2016: The company researchers achieve human parity in conversational speech recognition

8th December 2016: The company completed the acquisition of LinkedIn

17th March 2017: The company teams rolled out to Office 365 customers worldwide

23rd May 2017: The company announced Windows 10 China Government Edition

21st September 2017: The company, Facebook, and Telxius completed Marea, which is the highest-capacity subsea cable to cross the Atlantic Ocean

22nd February 2018: The company opened its campus in Dublin, Ireland

26th October 2018: The company completed the acquisition of GitHub

1st October 2019: The company collaborated with Danfoss for IoT solutions

1st September 2020: Microsoft agreed to acquire ZeniMax Media for US$7.5 billion

12th March 2021: Microsoft announced its plans to acquire Discord, a messaging platform

Bing Some Recent Milestones:

Bing is visually pleasing as a search engine

Bing provides instant answers and conveniently organizes information for the user

Bing blocked more than 5 Mn cryptocurrency advertisements in 2018, which is a new figure from the company reveal

In March 2019, Bing started incorporating LinkedIn data for search add targeting.

Fun facts:

In April 2019, the company launched action extensions to highlight calls-to-action, and the extensions feature one of 70 pre-defined calls-to-action.

In March 2019, Microsoft Corporation and Verizon Media announced a new multi-year global native advertising deal to create a single global search platform to reach audiences across Bing, Yahoo, and AOL networks.

In 2018, search advertising revenue increased US$ 791 Mn or 15%, and – excluding traffic acquisition costs – increased 9%, primarily driven by higher revenue per search and search volume.

In April 2019, the company launched action extensions to highlight calls-to-action, and the extensions feature one of 70 pre-defined calls-to-action.

In March 2019, Microsoft Corporation and Verizon Media announced a new multi-year global native advertising deal to create a single global search platform to reach audiences across Bing, Yahoo, and AOL networks.

In July 2019, more than 1.35 billion unique global visitors visited Bing.com

In July 2019, Bing accounted for 2.72 percent of the global search market

As of 2019, bing accounted for 12 billion monthly search requests worldwide, and in the US the monthly search volume to Bing.com was around 500 million

In Q1 2020, search advertising revenue excluding the traffic acquisition costs, increased by 11%, due to higher revenue per search.

Bing accounted for 2 percent of mobile search visits and 4 percent of overall U.S. organic search engine visits.

Microsoft is one of the top patent holder corporations in the US

Microsoft offers free candies and beverages to all its staffers. There are 35 cafeterias on the campus providing Italian, Mexican, and Chinese food, but Pizza is the most eaten food

Each employee in Microsoft is required to bring in a pound of M&Ms on their yearly anniversary

The campus of Microsoft has a high number of rabbits

Steve Jobs and Bill Gates were once friends. Google and Microsoft worked together on the development of software for the Macintosh computer.

Microsoft has more male employees than female

Pioneering musician Brian Eno composed the Microsoft sound or the Window 95’s startup tune

Microsoft has worked on its projects under various codenames

Microsoft has a large art collection

Bing users are 58% female

Yahoo and Bing ads allow using 40 characters in the title of ads, unlike Google which allows only 25 characters

Bing offers more support to small advertisements than Google

Microsoft has the second-highest market value of 946.5 billion US$ among the 100 largest companies in the world

The brand value of Microsoft in 2021 was 410 billion US$

In 2021, Bing accounts for 2.86% of the worldwide search engine market share

In 2021, Bing has 1.33% of the mobile search engine market share in the United States, following Yahoo! (2.32%) and DuckDuckGo (2.26%)

In 2021, Bing has 12.6% of the desktop search engine market share in the United States, following Google (79.47%) and followed by Yahoo! (4.6%) and DuckDuckGo (2.76%)

Bing has 7.2% of the desktop search engine market share in 2021. Google, on the other hand, has a market share of 86.19%

As of October 2021, Bing is available in 105 display languages globally

As of October 2021, Bing is available in 238 territories

Bing is the 9th most popular visited website in the United States by October 2021
